page.title: 20Life N.E. of the Longmynd
page.content:
People who live here follow the traditional pattern of life associated with the English countryside. The population is predominantly middle-aged to elderly,including many who are widowed.As in many areas,young people of all abilities find difficulty in obtaining employment. A number of newcomers have been attracted to the area and have been made welcome,although for some people the transition from town to country life can be a lengthy process. Both socially and practically,local people co-operate to produce a happy community atmosphere,and both residents and visitors alike are fully appreciative of the natural beauty of the area.
Compiled by three members of All Stretton Women's Institute.
